originalText.text: Dr Kurian is the best in the industry. Very helpful and concerned about her patients. Also, Dr Kurian’s staff is extremely courteous and helpful. Very informative visit..

text.text: Dr Kurian is the best in the industry. Very helpful and concerned about her patients. Also, Dr Kurian’s staff is extremely courteous and helpful. Very informative visit..

originalText.text:
I think Dr. Kurian is an excellent surgeon. The reason I gave her four rather than five stars is that I feel she does not provide enough support services pre and post op. She has an amazing nurse practitioner who underwent gastric bypass surgery five years ago and is kind and knowledgeable. However, the NP works only one day a week with the practice. Generally, patients pre-op might speak with the NP briefly once a month for several months and a few times after surgery.

Dr.Kurian has been responsive post-op. Both times that I called the office and asked that she call me, she called me back the same day and spoke to me briefly.

The fact that Dr. Kurian is essentially a stand-alone surgeon means there is much less bureaucracy than with surgeons who are part of a hospital bariatrics program. But there is also much less support. I did not feel I was adequately prepared for life after surgery. The scheduled sessions were too far apart to help with all the day to day questions. It happens I healed well and quickly, which I attribute to Dr. Kurian's skill as a surgeon. However, this general lack of support would have made it much harder if I had not healed as easily.

Dr. Kurian does provide access to a once a month Zoom group run by a social worker who herself underwent bariatric surgery some time back. I attended twice. The focus of the group seems to be recidivism - people who've fallen off the wagon. It wasn't helpful to a newbie. Perhaps a monthly group for post op newbies would be a great addition.

It would be fantastic if Dr. Kurian would consider adding to her practice another healthcare provider deeply experienced in bariatric medicine - perhaps a licensed RD nutritionist with a bariatrics speciality. This person might be delegated to answer patients' specific questions and issues regarding diet and weight loss after surgery and to run a biweekly or monthly support group.

originalText.text: Dr Kurian did an amazing job on my gastric sleeve surgery and I would recommend anyone intrested in doing this procedure to reach out to her with no hesitation. The staff at the office was very responsive, caring and supportive. Here I am 2.5 weeks post op feeling great and living my new life journey. Thank you again for taking great care of me.

The staff at the office was very responsive, caring and supportive. Here I am 2.5 weeks post op feeling great and living my new life journey. Thank you again for taking great care of me.

originalText.text: Dr. Kurian is a great doctor/surgeon.  In addtion, she is personable and caring and will help you reach your goals.  I don't think I would have maintain a 80 pound weight loss for 17 years without her support.

text.text: Dr. Kurian is a great doctor/surgeon.  In addtion, she is personable and caring and will help you reach your goals.  I don't think I would have maintain a 80 pound weight loss for 17 years without her support.

originalText.text:
Dr. Marina Kurian Md. it’s a great Dr. Extremely carrying and attentive with her patients. Her entire Office it’s as long, very professional. It’s harder until you make the decision that will most certainly change your life and visit her Office. From that point on, you’re in very good hands.
In my case I had complications from a previous surgery…coughing spitting mucus etc. Well, Dr. Marina Kurian had fixed all that and now I’m feeling like she’d added about 20 more years to my life spam. I basically feel like I’m flying.
